article.description: Doug McDermott had 24 points to lead Creighton to a 76-66 victory over Nebraska on Sunday.
article.headline: Doug McDermott's 24 points leads 7-0 Creighton by Nebraska
article.linkText: McDermott stars as 7-0 Creighton tops Huskers
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. -- Doug McDermott had 24 points to lead Creighton (No. 22 ESPN/USA Today) to a 76-66 victory over Nebraska on Sunday. McDermott made three free throws after a pair of technical fouls were called on the Cornhuskers with 9:14 left. Nebraska's Toney McCray was called for a technical foul after he fouled Creighton's Grant Gibbs. Angered by the technical on McCray, Nebraska coach Doc Sadler moved down the sideline and sat on the scorer's table and received another technical. McDermott made three of the four technical free throws and Gibbs hit both of his free throws to put Creighton up 51-45. McDermott followed with a three-point play that put the Bluejays (7-0) up by nine. Nebraska (4-3) never got closer than seven after that. Antoine Young had 14 points for Creighton and Gibbs finished with 11. Bo Spencer led Nebraska with 29 points, McCray had 15 and Jorge Brian Diaz added 10.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
